recommendations: Avoid going outside during peak pollution hours.
Use a mask with particle filters when air quality is poor.
Keep windows closed and use air purifiers indoors.
Avoid intense outdoor exercise when pollutant levels are high.
Plant vegetation near your home to improve local air quality.
Use earplugs or noise-canceling headphones in noisy areas.
Avoid living or sleeping near busy roads or industrial zones.
Close windows and doors during periods of intense noise.
Install acoustic insulation materials at home, such as thick curtains or sound-absorbing panels.
Avoid exposing children and elderly people to high noise levels for long periods.
Use certified water filters for lead and arsenic.
Avoid drinking water from unknown or untreated sources.
Boiling water can eliminate some microorganisms, but not heavy metals.
Drink bottled water in case of contamination alerts.
Report any water quality issues to local authorities for inspection.
